item.title: Comex铜价创下新高，Trafigura和IXM陷入空头挤压
item.description: 五位直接了解情况的消息人士称，大宗商品交易商 Trafigura 和 IXM 正在寻求实物铜，以弥补芝加哥商品交易所（CME）的大量看跌头寸，周三美国铜价飙升至历史新高。【原文：Commodity traders Trafigura and IXM are seeking physical copper to cover large bearish positions on the CME, where U.S. copper prices surged to record highs on Wednesday, five sources with direct knowledge of the situation said.】

item.title: 视频游戏制造商育碧全年营业利润创历史新高
item.description: 法国视频游戏集团育碧（Ubisoft）周三表示，截至 3 月底的全年业绩转为营业利润，创纪录的预订额帮助该公司扭转了去年同期 5 亿欧元的亏损，这是该公司有史以来最大的亏损。【原文：French video games group Ubisoft swung to an operating profit for its full-year to end-March, it said on Wednesday, as record bookings helped it reverse a year earlier loss of 500 million euros, its biggest ever.】

item.title: Anthropic 聘用 Instagram 联合创始人担任产品总监
item.description: 人工智能初创公司Anthropic周三表示，该公司已任命Instagram联合创始人迈克-克里格（Mike Krieger）为首席产品官，希望借此完善其人工智能产品并领先于竞争对手。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup Anthropic has appointed Instagram co-founder Mike Krieger as its chief product officer, the company said on Wednesday, it looks to spruce up its AI offerings and get ahead of rivals.】

item.title: Uber 推出美国班车服务，扩大与好市多的合作以吸引价格敏感型用户
item.description: 优步（Uber Technologies）将在美国推出班车服务，并扩大与会员制零售商好市多的送货合作，这是优步周三公布的一系列举措的一部分，目的是在竞争对手 Lyft 的竞争中吸引注重价格的消费者。【原文：Uber Technologies is introducing a shuttle service in the U.S. and widening a delivery tie-up with membership-only retailer Costco as part of a series of initiatives unveiled on Wednesday to attract price-conscious consumers amid competition from rival Lyft .】

item.title: 美国法官驳回声称优步藏匿荷兰避税港的诉讼
item.description: 美国一名法官驳回了一项集体诉讼提议，该诉讼指控优步科技公司隐瞒其荷兰子公司作为避税天堂的事实，欺骗股东。【原文：A U.S. judge has dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit accusing Uber Technologies of defrauding shareholders by concealing its use of its Netherlands subsidiary as a tax haven.】

item.title: 因违反停机坪延误规定，美国对沃乐瑞公司罚款 30 万美元
item.description: 美国交通部周三表示，已对墨西哥航空公司 Volaris Airlines 罚款 30 万美元，原因是该公司违反了有关机场停机坪延误的联邦法律。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said Wednesday it had fined Mexican carrier Volaris Airlines $300,000 for violating federal law on airport tarmac delays.】

item.title: EIA 称美国原油、汽油和馏分油库存下降
item.description: 美国能源信息署（EIA）周三称，在截至5月10日的一周内，美国原油库存、汽油库存和馏分油库存均有所下降。【原文：U.S. crude stocks, gasoline and distillate inventories fell in the week ending May 10, the Energy Information Administration (EIA) said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份商业库存下降
item.description: 3 月份美国企业库存下降，但这可能为企业重建库存和支持第二季度经济增长奠定基础。【原文：U.S. business inventories fell in March, but this could lay the ground for businesses to rebuild stocks and support economic growth in the second quarter.】

item.title: 美国住宅建筑商情绪暴跌，因为利率降低导致购房者减少
item.description: 周三公布的数据显示，由于住房贷款利率居高不下，潜在客户持观望态度，更多的建筑商不得不推出优惠措施吸引购房者，5月份美国住宅建筑商的情绪出现了六个月来的首次下滑。【原文：U.S. homebuilder sentiment soured in May for the first time in six months as high interest rates on home loans kept potential customers on the sidelines and more builders had to offer incentives to lure buyers, data out Wednesday showed.】

item.title: Veon 与合作伙伴携手弥合在线 "人工智能语言鸿沟
item.description: 电信公司Veon、移动运营商Beeline Kazakhstan、巴塞罗那超级计算中心和GSMA游说团体周三表示，他们将共同努力，为代表性不足的语言弥合 "人工智能语言差距"。【原文：Telecom company Veon , mobile operator Beeline Kazakhstan, the Barcelona Supercomputing Center and the GSMA lobby group said on Wednesday they would work together to bridge an "AI language gap" for under-represented languages.】

item.title: 独家报道招聘人员称，死亡的美国银行银行家曾以工作时间过长为由要求离职
item.description: 本月早些时候因血栓死亡的 35 岁美国银行投资银行家希望离开这家美国银行，因为他每周的工作时间超过了 100 小时，据一位与他谈过寻找新工作的高管招聘人员说。【原文：The 35-year-old Bank of America investment banker who died from a blood clot earlier this month wanted to leave the U.S. bank because he was working more than 100 hours a week, according to an executive recruiter who spoke with him about seeking a new job.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司首席执行官下台，股价暴跌 8
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）称，其首席执行官将由一名与总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）观点更接近的前监管者接替，此后该公司股价在周三开盘交易中下跌超过 8%。【原文：Shares in Brazil's Petrobras fell more than 8% in opening Wednesday trading, after the state-run oil firm said its chief executive would be replaced by a former regulator with views closer to those of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Netflix 接近达成 NFL 比赛协议
item.description: 彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道称，Netflix 正在敲定一项协议，购买圣诞节期间两场全国橄榄球联盟比赛的独家播放权。【原文：Netflix is finalizing a deal to buy exclusive rights to stream two National Football League games on Christmas Day, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 贝莱德高管薪酬仅赢得股东微弱支持
item.description: 资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）周三表示，在其年度会议上，只有约 58% 的咨询投票支持其高层管理人员的薪酬。【原文：Asset manager BlackRock on Wednesday said only about 58% of advisory votes cast at its annual meeting supported the pay of its top executives.】

item.title: CREA 数据显示，加拿大 4 月成屋销售下降 1.7
item.description: 加拿大房地产协会（CREA）周三公布的数据显示，4月份加拿大成屋销售量比3月份下降了1.7%，年增长率为10.1%。【原文：Canadian home sales declined 1.7% in April from March, and were up 10.1% on an annual basis, data from the Canadian Real Estate Association (CREA) showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 报告称，食品成本上升让饥饿的美国人落后了 330 亿美元
item.description: 据全国性反饥饿组织 "反哺美国 "的一份报告称，2022 年，美国的饥饿人口将面临 331 亿美元的基本食品需求资金缺口，但其中近一半的人将没有资格获得援助。【原文：Hungry people in the U.S. faced a $33.1 billion shortfall in funds for basic food needs in 2022, but nearly half of them will not qualify for aid, according to a report by national anti-hunger group Feeding America.】

item.title: 高盛从竞争对手处招聘人员，拓展中型市场交易
item.description: 高盛告诉路透社，该公司已分别从 Evercore 和 Lazard 聘请了两名投资银行家 Kerry Burke 和 Eddie Rubin，以加倍拓展其业务，重点为价值高达 20 亿美元的交易提供咨询。【原文：Goldman Sachs told Reuters it has hired two investment bankers, Kerry Burke and Eddie Rubin, from Evercore and Lazard , respectively, as part of a push to double down on its business that focuses on advising on deals worth up to $2 billion.】

item.title: 美国 4 月零售销售意外持平
item.description: 美国 4 月份的零售额出人意料地持平，原因是汽油价格上涨拉动了其他商品的消费，表明消费支出正在失去动力。【原文：U.S. retail sales were unexpectedly flat in April as higher gasoline prices pulled spending away from other goods, indicating that consumer spending was losing momentum.】

item.title: VIEW 美国消费者价格涨幅低于预期；零售销售持平
item.description: 美国 4 月份消费者物价增幅低于预期，表明通胀在第二季度初恢复了下降趋势，这刺激了金融市场对 9 月份降息的预期。【原文：U.S. consumer prices increased less than expected in April, suggesting that inflation resumed its downward trend at the start of the second quarter in a boost to financial market expectations for a September interest rate cut.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长表示将全力实现 3% 的通胀目标
item.description: 巴西央行行长罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）周三表示，货币当局致力于实现 3% 的通胀目标，其政策讨论 "甚至不应提及 "该目标的中心和波段。【原文：Brazil's central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto said on Wednesday that the monetary authority is committed to pursuing its 3% inflation target, and that its policy discussions should "not even mention" the center and band of that goal.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，摩根士丹利将购买与倒闭的 Signature Bank 相关的 7 亿美元房产贷款
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，摩根士丹利已与一个投资者团体达成协议，将购买与倒闭的 Signature Bank 相关的 7 亿美元房地产贷款。【原文：Morgan Stanley has struck a deal with an investor group to buy $700 million of property loans tied to the failed Signature Bank, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大 3 月份工厂销售额因石油和汽车而下降 2.1
item.description: 5月15日（路透社）--加拿大统计局（Statistics Canada）周三称，由于石油和煤炭产品以及汽车销售量下降，加拿大3月份的工厂销售额比2月份下降了2.1%。【原文：May 15 (Reuters) - Canadian factory sales fell by 2.1% in March from February on lower sales of petroleum and coal products, as well as motor vehicles, Statistics Canada said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西经济活动在 3 月份萎缩的情况下仍实现了第一季度的增长
item.description: 巴西央行周三公布的数据显示，巴西经济 3 月份的萎缩程度高于预期，但第一季度仍取得了积极的表现。【原文：Brazil's economy exhibited a higher-than-expected contraction in March but still managed to clinch a positive performance in the first quarter, central bank data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 4 月消费者价格涨幅低于预期；核心 CPI 放缓
item.description: 美国 4 月份消费者物价增幅低于预期，表明通胀在第二季度初恢复了下降趋势，这刺激了金融市场对 9 月份降息的预期。【原文：U.S. consumer prices increased less than expected in April, suggesting that inflation resumed its downward trend at the start of the second quarter in a boost to financial market expectations for a September interest rate cut.】

item.title: 餐饮企业 Compass 表示，周一工人将返回办公室
item.description: 全球最大的餐饮公司康帕斯集团周三表示，在美国和英国的办公室食堂，周一现在和周四一样繁忙。【原文：Mondays are now as busy as Thursdays in office canteens in the United States and Britain, the world's largest food catering firm Compass Group said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 空中客车公司推出半飞机半直升机，以追求速度
item.description: 空中客车直升机公司（Airbus Helicopters）周三展示了一款半飞机半直升机的实验机型，以追求速度，为未来旋翼机的定义竞争进入白热化。【原文：Airbus Helicopters showcased an experimental half-plane, half-helicopter on Wednesday in a quest for speed as competition heats up to define the rotorcraft of the future.】

item.title: 中国尼欧诺推出 Onvo 品牌，挑战特斯拉最畅销车型
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商尼奥周三推出了其新品牌 Onvo 旗下的首款汽车，售价较低，旨在与全球最畅销的电动汽车特斯拉 Model Y 竞争。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker Nio on Wednesday launched the first vehicle under its new brand Onvo to be priced at a lower range and which aims to compete with Tesla's Model Y, the world's best-selling EV.】

item.title: 据天空新闻报道，摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙赞成与中国全面接触
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）周三在接受天空新闻采访时表示，美国政府与中国全面接触是正确的做法，并补充说中国政府是西方世界的激烈竞争对手，但 "不是敌人"。【原文：The U.S. government is doing the right thing by fully engaging with China, JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon said in an interview with Sky News on Wednesday, adding that Beijing was a fierce competitor, but "not an enemy" of the Western world.】

item.title: 被锁定的加密货币投资者在比特币热潮中恐慌，钱包恢复公司热闹非凡
item.description: 最近，比特币价格飙升，加密钱包恢复公司的电话响个不停，被锁在数字保险库外的散户投资者疯狂地打电话，希望重新获得他们的账户。【原文：The recent surge in bitcoin prices has the phones at crypto wallet recovery firms ringing off the hook, as retail investors locked out of their digital vaults make frantic calls to regain access to their accounts.】

item.title: 弗兰克-麦考特的自由计划组成财团竞购 TikTok 的美国业务
item.description: 企业家、前洛杉矶道奇队老板弗兰克-麦考特（Frank McCourt）周三表示，他的非营利组织自由计划（Project Liberty）正在组建一个财团，收购美国社交媒体平台 TikTok。【原文：Entrepreneur and former Los Angeles Dodgers owner Frank McCourt said on Wednesday his non profit Project Liberty is forming a consortium to buy social media platform TikTok in the United States.】
